title: A minor extension of the logistic equation for growth of word counts on online media: Parametric description of diversity of growth phenomena in society. (arXiv:2211.16733v2 [physics.soc-ph] UPDATED)
abstract: To understand the growing phenomena of new vocabulary on nationwide online social media, we analyzed monthly word count time series extracted from approximately 1 billion Japanese blog articles from 2007 to 2019. In particular, we first introduced the extended logistic equation by adding one parameter to the original equation and showed that the model can consistently reproduce various patterns of actual growth curves, such as the logistic function, linear growth, and finite-time divergence. Second, by analyzing the model parameters, we found that the typical growth pattern is not only a logistic function, which often appears in various complex systems, but also a nontrivial growth curve that starts with an exponential function and asymptotically approaches a power function without a steady state. Furthermore, we observed a connection between the functional form of growth and the peak-out. Finally, we showed that the proposed model and statistical properties are also valid for Google T

translated_abstract: 本文对从2007年至2019年约10亿篇日本博客文章中提取的月度词汇计数时间序列进行了分析，以了解全国范围内在线社交媒体上新词汇的增长现象。我们首先引入了扩展的Logistic方程，通过向原方程添加一个参数，展示了该模型可以一致地再现实际增长曲线的各种模式，例如Logistic函数、线性增长和有限时间发散。其次，通过分析模型参数，我们发现了典型的生长模式不仅是Logistic函数（在各种复杂系统中常见），还是一种非平凡的生长曲线，从指数函数开始，并渐近地趋于无稳态的幂函数。此外，我们观察到了生长的函数形式和“峰值”的联系。最后，我们证明了所提出的模型和统计特性对Google T同样适用。
tldr: 本研究基于日本博客文章数据，通过扩展Logistic方程，并添加参数，展示了模型可以一致地再现实际增长曲线的各种模式，并发现了典型的生长模式是一种非平凡的幂函数，该模型和统计特性对Google T同样适用。
en_tdlr: This study analyzes monthly word count time series extracted from approximately one billion Japanese blog articles from 2007 to 2019 and proposes an extended logistic equation with an added parameter to reproduce various growth patterns. The typical growth pattern is found to be a nontrivial power function, and the proposed model and statistical properties are also valid for Google T.
